body.S: The best way to stay motivated to make a change is to develop a realistic plan for improvement and measure and track your progress! Try writing down a specific, realistic plan for improving your diet today!

The best way to stay motivated to make a chance is to develop a realistic plan for improvement and measure and track your progress! Try writing down a specific, realistic plan for increasing physical activity today!
A great way to help you stay motivated is to recognize the small successes you make on the way to improving your diet and reward yourself!
A great way to help you stay motivated is to recognize the small successes you make on the way to meeting your physical activity goal and reward yourself!
Think about all the progress you've already made in improving your diet and how much closer you are now to reaching your ultimate goals!
Think about all the progress you've already made in increasing physical activity and how much closer you are now to reaching your ultimate goals!
Tracking your progress towards improving your diet and recognizing your successes along the way can help remind you of your goals and help keep you motivated!
Tracking your progress towards increasing your physical activity and recognizing your successes along the way can help remind you of your goals and help keep you motivated!
Working towards increasing your physical activity with a friend or family member can help keep you both motivated and on track through some friendly competition!
Working towards a healthier diet with a friend or family member can help keep you both motivated and on track through some friendly competition!
Family and friends can give you support and encouragement to keep you motivated. Who can you reach out to today for support in meeting your goal for a healthier diet?
Family and friends can give you support and encouragement to keep you motivated. Who can you reach out to today for support in meeting your physical activity goal?

Going out to dinner can make it difficult to choose healthy food options. Try to look at menus online ahead of time to choose restaurants that have nutritious dishes lower in calories, sugar, and fat!
Next time you go out to eat, consider swapping out french fries or chips for a vegetable side dish like a salad or steamed broccoli!

Restaurants often serve large portions. Try ordering an appetizer instead or splitting an entr√©e with a friend! Apps like MyFitnessPal can help you figure out approximate calories in your meal and track your daily caloric intake.

When eating at a restaurant, don't be afraid to ask the waiter how a meal is prepared including what kind of oil is used or what ingredients may be in the meal that are not listed in the menu. Knowing more about the food can help you make healthy choices!
A way to avoid eating too much at social gatherings or when you go out to eat with friends is to have a healthy snack beforehand so you aren't so hungry!

It might feel overwhelming to choose healthy options from a restaurant menu. Keeping your eye out for words like "broiled," "low-fat," "steamed," or "baked" can help you identify the healthier dishes.
A helpful tip for preventing over-eating is to drink water frequently, both before and during a meal. Drinking more water can help you stay hydrated and also helps you feel full!
A heart-healthy diet involves foods that are low in calories, salt, and fat and high in fiber. What are some healthy choices you can make today?
Sitting for long periods of time can be detrimental to heart health. Try standing up every half hour and moving around for two minutes!
The mind-body connection is a strong one. Stress is not only harmful for your mind but also harmful for your heart. If you are feeling stressed, try pausing and taking several deep breaths.
Believe it or not, a small amount of healthy fat can be good for your heart! Foods like avocado, nuts, or olive oil are low in saturated and trans fats and are healthy choices to eat in moderation.
Skin and fat on meats are high in cholesterol, which can be detrimental to your heart health. When eating meat, consider removing the skin and cutting away the fat for a more heart-healthy meal!
High-fat dairy products can contain high levels of cholesterol. For a heart healthy option, try low- or non-fat dairy products instead!
